page.title: 03Granite quarrying, St Mary 2
page.content: The quarry is composed of granite. Blasting happens once a week which means they are left with very large lumps of stone. These are broken up by a big ball on a crane. They then load it into large trucks which drop the granite into the primary crusher. This then results in pieces of granite or rock about 4-10 inches across. These are then fed into a secondary crusher producing finer granite. All men start at 8 am and each goes about his separate job. Ready mixed concrete is carried all over the island. Concrete slabs are used for patios. Concrete blocks come in many sizes, the main selling one being 4x9x18 inches. Lightweight blocks are made of pumice from Italy. All kinds of granite products are made. A laboratory deals with concrete mixes and design.
